I contend that criminals should be deprived of some civil rights.

They are.
 
 What exactly did you have in mind.

They are.
 
 What exactly did you have in mind.
I know they are. I think they should be deprived of more of them.
 
 I don't have cruel and inhumane treatment in mind, but they don't deserve the ammenities of home as we so expensively provide them with due to the bleeding hearts and activist saviours of the "pitiful" incarcerated.

I contend that criminals should be deprived of some civil rights.

 
 Which civil rights? Take away a right?
 
 I don't think "ammenities of home" would be classified under civil rights. I don't think we should take away civil rights but I agree prison shouldn't be fun, it's punishment after all.
Should we take away the so called "right to privacy" ...that fundamental right that is above all other rights.

Should we take away the so called "right to privacy" ...that fundamental right that is above all other rights.

 I guess that would depend upon what you mean by privacy. I consider my office desk drawers private, and expect people to respect that privacy. In the case of a prisoner though, I think they deserve little physical privacy. I support the idea that prison officials and guards should be able to search a prisoners cell, work area, recreational area, and even their rectum whenever they want to. With prisoners comes the dangers of drugs, contraband, shanks, and other weapons that can harm the guards or other inmates. I think physical privacy is one thing prisoners absolutely should not have, and thankfully, they for the most part do not.

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  Criminals and civil rights
